title: Mansion Global Daily: Flatlining U.K. Home Prices, Melbourne's Million-Dollar Sales and More
text:
U.K. House Prices Flatline in September

Political chaos over Brexit sent home price growth tumbling to its slowest quarter in six years. Read More

BY THE NUMBERS

TRENDING TODAY

LISTING OF THE DAY

Modern, Poured-Concrete Mansion on Florida’s Jupiter Island

The new spec house has dual frontage on the Atlantic Ocean and Intracoastal Waterway. Read More

TAX TALK

What are Property Taxes on a Home You’re Renting Out in Sydney, Australia?

The fees are the same whether it’s a main residence or a rental, but there are possible tax breaks to consider. Read More

NEWS BITES

Singapore’s Rising Prices Spark Concerns About Cooling Measures Increases in an index for private home prices in Singapore have awakened concerns that the government might choose to enact measures to cool prices. The Urban Redevelopment Authority index showed prices growing by 0.9% in the third quarter of 2019 over the previous quarter, after 1.5% growth in the second quarter. Some anticipate that by the end of the year, the increases will have reached between 2% and 2.5%. BusinessTimes

Million-Dollar Sales Seen in Melbourne As Australian Market Recovers Melbourne has seen a recent spree of high-ticket sales. A 1930s mansion recently sold for A$13 million (US$8.7 million) after two months on the market, and the real estate firm saw interest from buyers from China, Malaysia and Singapore. A nearby home also just sold for between $10.5 million and $11.5 million after first being listed in March. Realestate.com.au

Australia’s Ultra-Wealthy Population Expected to Grow A new report anticipates the number of extremely wealthy Australians—defined as those with a net worth above A$44.8 million (US$30 million)—to increase by 20% within the next five years. A Knight Frank report sees this as a clear sign the appetite for luxury properties will also expand. One-third of the wealth of Australians in this category comes from property, with each having, on average, three homes. Financial Review

Vancouver Real Estate Shows Signs of Revitalizing Vancouver’s real estate market is showing signs of regaining its footing after experiencing a significant decline as a result of government measures aimed at combating once-skyrocketing price growth. Sales increased month over month by 46% in September, the third month in a row of increases. Prices have yet to rally, however, and the benchmark price slipped by 7.3% year-over-year in September. Bloomberg

AROUND NEWS CORP

description: Mansion Global’s daily round-up of the latest luxury real estate news from around the world
